1522.content:
On a fall day, the mall in a normal city was full of people of different races and genders. Many of them were walking around, looking at stores and buying the different foods located at the mall. Many friends were hanging out with one another while others were in the mall by themselves. One of those people was a girl who was currently on the move. She was a girl who liked to wear skater clothing, especially clothing from Hot Topic. She was wearing a black hoodie that had designs on it with a torn pair of skinny jeans, black shoes, and a black skater beanie. Under her hoodie was a black tank top that showed how skinny she really way. For those who did not know her, her name was Emily.

Emily had some what of a shy personality, having some issues with her self confidence, but she was a pretty girl with brown hair that went down to her shoulders, tan skin, and brown eyes. She was short and very skinny, in fact, underweight. When people looked at her, they would believe that she was a skater girl. In reality, she was just a normal girl who liked the color black and liked listening to alternative rock music.

Emily was starting to enjoy her life more as she had met a new guy named Michael. She had feelings for him, hoping that he feels the same way. Luckily for her, she had no school today and was excited to see Michael later on. She was just wondering what to do to kill time. She didn't like beingaround her family, which was why she was at the mall. After a few minutes, Emily found something to do and somewhere to go.
1522.title: Meeting Emily

choices: Buy the shirt and say its for a friend
Ask if there's anywhere else she could find that shirt
15222.content:
Emily let her feet guide her, not really caring where she went as she wondered aimlessly through the mall. There was music playing overhead, though the sounds of people enjoying themselves made it sound like more of a slightly melodic hum than actual music. Emily effortlessly weaved in and out of the other shoppers as she glanced in the windows of each shop she passed, hoping that something would catch her eye.

She was almost to the end of the mall when she stopped, her eyes drawn to a shirt inside a store that looked like just her style. Instinctively she changed course, as her feet carried her into the shop. The floor changed from tile to a beige carpet, and the din of the mall grew quieter as she strode into a sea of clothes. There was only a couple other women in the store besides the plump attendant who was folding shirts at the register.

Emily quickly reached the shirt, as her eyes went wide. There was a whole section of shirts that were just her style! She began rifling through the different designs, trying to decide which one to get. They had such a good selection, she was surprised that she hadn't been in this store before. Though now that she thought about it, she didn't even know which store she was in. Not that it mattered. They had such a great selection.

Finally, she decided on a shirt and began looking at the sizes. Large. Extra-Large. Extra-Extra-Large. No matter how deep she dug in the pile of shirts she couldn't seem to find anything smaller than a large, which would be way to big on her wiry body. She let out a sigh. Maybe the attendant would be able to find a small for her.

Steeling herself she glanced at the counter near the front of the store. The attendant was definitely plus-sized though she still looked really cute. She had her blond hair in a stylish bun, and her black-framed glasses made her look surprisingly chill. Her extra weight really made her look young with a round face.

Taking one more deep breath, Emily grabbed one of the shirts and strode up to the counter, "Excuse me."

The attendant smiled at Emily, making her look even more youthful as she replied in a sing-songy voice, "Yes? How can I help you?"

Emily set the shirt on the counter for the attendant to see, "I was wondering if maybe you had this in a small."

The plump girl chuckled slightly, "I'm sorry miss, but I think you're a little too small to be shopping in this store. We cater to plus-sized women."

Emily felt her face turning red as she glanced around the store. Sure enough, everyone in here was at least plus-sized if not bigger. Even the other teen girl off in one of the corners. She looked back at the attendant, noticing her name badge said Lisa, as she watched Emily to see if there was anything else she could do for her. Emily glanced back at the shirt lifting it in her hands.

She stared intently at the shirt, trying to avoid showing Lisa how red she obviously was. She hadn't even realized she'd walked into a plus-sized shop. She'd just saw the shirt and had been drawn in. She really did want the shirt, but there was no way it would fit on her. However, it wasn't like she'd seen this shirt anywhere else. This shop probably had the rights to it or something.

She flipped the shirt over, holding it up to better look it over. The material felt nice to the touch, not too rough and not to soft. She even had the perfect accessories to go with it. The only problem was that it was designed for girls who weren't underweight.

Emily bit her lip, trying to decide what to do. She'd already embarrassed herself by asking if they had a small in a plus-sized store. Still, maybe she could just buy the shirt and say it was for a friend, and was wondering if they had any smaller sizes because she thought it looked really cute. The attendant would probably buy that story. Though then she'd be stuck with a shirt that there was no way she was going to fit in unless she put on like fifty pounds. Still, the doctor did say she needed to put on at least 40 pounds. So even though it would be lose, the shirt would probably fit better then.

However, she could also just cut her loses and leave. It probably wasn't the first time someone had asked that question of the attendant. She'd probably understand. Still, she just wished she wasn't so underweight. It would definitely make things easier. That was a problem for a different time though. Right now she needed to decide what to do with the shirt.
15222.title: Out of Place

choices: Go all out, and try to stretch her belly to the max
152221.content:
Emily steeled herself, "This is for a friend. I just thought it would be cool if we had matching shirts."

Lisa smiled, "Ah, unfortunately large is the smallest size we carry. That shirt has been pretty popular, so whatever we have out is all we've got."

"Are you going to get anymore in?"

"The company that made that shirt has gone out of business, so I doubt you'll be able to find that shirt anywhere else. And that also means that once it's gone we won't be restocking it."

Emily let out a disappointed sigh as she clutched the shirt to her chest, "Alright, I'll take it."

A few minutes later she was walking out of the plus-sized store with her new purchase hanging in a bag on her arm. She pulled her phone out of her back pocket, glancing at the time before sliding it back into its storage space. She still had an hour until she was going to meet Michael at that new all-you-can-eat place just down the street. Her stomach let out a loud growl as she began wandering through the mall.

She watched her feet as she walked, lost in thought. She wasn't sure why she'd bothered buying that shirt. There was no way that it would fit on her, but it had just been so her. Still, she had put on a couple of pounds the last week or so. That was probably due to Michael always taking her out to places with really big portion sizes or buffets. Though it wasn't like she was too worried about her weight right now. If anything it would be good if she put on a few more pounds. Maybe then she would be able to fit into her new shirt without drowning in it.

"Hey Emily! What's up?"

Emily jumped slightly, looking for the whoever was calling her name. She nodded at the plump girl who was waving at her. The girl was definitely fat, though she was still really cute. Her round face actually made her look younger than she was, though one look at her oversized bosom sagging on her round belly would quickly correct that notion. Emily chuckled as she watched the girl's skin-tight shirt start riding up on her belly as she jumped up and down, trying to get Emily's attention.

Emily made her way through the crowd of people towards the wide girl, "Hey Sam. What you doin' here?"

"Just thought I'd get some food." Sam said, holding up a large burger for emphasis.

Emily noticed a couple other burger wrappers on the bench by Sam, as well as another uneaten burger on her other side, "Sweet. I'm just killing time until I meet up with Michael."

Sam rolled her eyes and took a big bite of her burger, "You two are such a couple."

Emily plopped down on the bench next to Sam, "What's that supposed to mean?"

Sam just shook her head, taking another bite of her burger. She licked the sauce off her hand before handing Emily the uneaten burger. Emily unwrapped the burger and took a large bite from the greasy goodness. She closed her eyes, savoring the savory flavor.

Emily smiled as she glanced at the large girl beside her. They'd been friends since kindergarten, though they'd both been about the same size back then. However, even then it had been obvious that Samantha loved to eat. She was always complaining about how hungry she was, or stuffing her face if she had the chance. She had never really cared about what others would think of her and just seemed to enjoy herself. Though, it wasn't like Emily was too much different.

Emily didn't really care what others thought of her body. It wasn't like she'd really been trying to stay skinny, she just wasn't into food like Sam was. Though, she was finding herself indulging herself a lot more often since she'd been hanging out with Michael. The big difference between her and Sam was that while she spent most of her money on clothes or movies, Sam spent most of her money on food.

"So what you got there?" Sam asked, gesturing towards Emily's bag with her burger.

"Just a shirt I thought was cool. It's a little too big, but I figure I can wear it if I ever put on some weight."

"Not likely. I can't picture you as anything other than a twig." Sam laughed through a mouthful of burger.

Emily turned her attention to the floor, taking another bite of the delicious burger. Honestly, she wouldn't mind being chubby or even called fat, but it was the fact that everyone just saw her as a twig that bugged her. It wasn't like she was trying. Though that seemed to annoy everyone even more. The fact that she could be a twig with no effort, and they had to work just to stay average. She was sure she got teased more because she was a twig that she would if she was chubby. Especially since in this day and age, it seemed like everyone was at least a little chubby.

Sam put a thick arm around Emily's shoulders, pulling her close to her soft body, "So, what you and Michael going to do?"

"We're going to try that new buffet place just down the street."

"You'll have to let me know how it is."

"For sure."

"I've been wanting to try that place, but I just haven't been able to get there yet." Sam said, leaning back on the bench, causing her shirt to ride up her belly, exposing her belly button, "Looks like its almost time to get some new clothes."

"Didn't you just get those just a couple of weeks ago?"

"Yeah," Sam said, tugging on her shirt as she tried to get it around her bloated belly, "but I think they must have shrunk."

Emily smiled as she shoved the last of her burger into her mouth. She was sure that shrinking wasn't the problem. Ever since Sam had gotten that new job that payed her quite a bit she'd been blowing up like a balloon. She'd been chubby for a couple of years, but lately she'd finally progressed to being fat, and it looked like she was showing no signs of stopping her expansion. At this rate she might be able to make a bid for fattest girl in school in a few months.

Scoffing Emily leaned back on the bench, staring at the glass ceiling. Honestly, she was kind of jealous of Sam. She seemed so happy, and everyone seemed to like her, so it wasn't like she really ever got teased about her weight. Maybe she should ask Sam for some help putting on a little weight. Just so that she was more average. She had no idea how to go about that though. It wasn't like she could just say, 'hey your fat, can you help me put on some weight?'

Emily pulled out her phone, glancing at the time again. She let out a sigh and stood up, tossing the empty wrapper on the pile of wrappers by Sam, "Well, I've got to go. I'll talk to you later."

Sam just nodded, trying to swallow the mouthful of burger she was working on.

Emily made her way towards the exit, emerging into the bright sunlight. She shielded her eyes as she waited for them to adjust to the natural light of day. She caught a slight hint of cinnamon on the crisp breeze that caused her to wrap her arms around herself. She watched as a few leaves fell to the ground from the trees in front of the mall, as a gentle rustling filled the air. She could see the restaurant at the far end of the parking lot, just past the end of the mall.

A few minutes later she was walking up towards the front door, when she noticed a tall blond boy waiting on the bench just outside. He stood up and started walking towards her when he noticed she was approaching.

"Were you waiting long?"

"Not really," he said, pulling her into a kiss, "probably five minutes."

Emily could feel his hand running up and down her thin body, "Alright, well let's head inside."

The two of them walked inside. It was pretty crowded, but they were able to get a table quickly. Michael went off to load up a plate of food, while Emily left her things at the table.

She frowned, watching Michael's back as he disappeared from view. Maybe she was being paranoid, but it almost seemed like Michael was disappointed that she was so thin too. He always seemed to look a little disappointed whenever his hands ran into one of her many exposed bones, and he often seemed disappointed that he couldn't really take her flesh in his hands. Still, it wasn't like she had really been trying to gain weight either, but after today she was beginning to wonder if maybe she should work on putting on some weight.

Looking around at the numerous people around her, most of them chubby, she couldn't help feeling out of place with how skinny she was. This wouldn't be a bad place to start gaining a bit of weight. But what if Michael didn't like her after she put on weight? Well, honestly it probably wouldn't be too hard for her to lose the weight if that was the case, but something kept telling her that wouldn't be a problem. Still, it was a big decision to decide to actively try to gain weight. What if she couldn't stop herself and ended up like Sam? Though it wasn't like Sam seemed unhappy.

What to do...?
152221.title: A Fat "Friend"

choices: Suggest some bedroom fun, her parents are out of town
Call it a night. She has a doctors appointment in the morning
Suggest they go to the skatepark
Call it a night, she wants to get another look at the fat girl
Call it a night. She wants some alone time in her room.
1522212.content:
Emily was quiet as she followed Michael into the restaurant. Thoughts raced through her head as she tried to decide what to do. On the one hand, she was definitely a bit curious about what it would be like to gain some weight. On the other, she really cared about Michael and she didn't want to disappoint him. She could ask him about it, but she didn't want him to think she was weird for even suggesting something like that. She could also work at putting on some weight and see if he reacted at all.

She followed Michael through the crowd of mostly chubby or fat people towards the cashier, listening to the sounds of people chatting and eating. The smell of delicious food wafted from the dining area, causing her mouth to water.

She watched as he paid the cashier for the two of them, though she found her eyes wandering towards the many overweight people around her. Her eyes drifted lazily around the dining area, taking everything in as she contemplated what to do.

Suddenly her eyes fixated on one person as she felt a fluttering in her chest. She didn't even care that she was staring as she looked at the large girl across the dining area.

If she didn't know any better, she would say that it was her twin. Though slightly older and quite a bit heavier. The girl was probably about eighteen, and was probably three times Emily's weight. She was with a couple of friends that also were pretty chubby, and the three of them were laughing at something one of them said. A large pile of empty plates littered the table as the three of them continued feasting on more food than Emily ate in a week.

"Emi?"

Emily jumped slightly as Michael put his arm on her shoulder, looking a bit concerned, "Sorry. I zoned out for a minute."

Michael chuckled, glancing in the direction she had been looking. She was sure he saw them. The three girls eating to their heart's content. However, he didn't say anything about it. Instead, he took her hand and led her into the dining area. A moment later they were sitting down at an empty table with a rather good view of the three girls. Emily wasn't sure if that was intentional or not, but she found herself glancing their way more often than she anticipated. Though she was sure she wasn't the only one at the table doing that.

Once they were settled in, she got up to get some food. She moved easily through the crowd of people at the buffet tables. Her small size allowing her to squeeze into areas others couldn't. Though she found herself trying to watch the girl through the crowd, but she kept losing site of the three girls.

She whipped her head around as she bumped into something soft, "I'm so sorry. I-"

She stopped as she realized she'd bumped into the girl she'd been watching. She hadn't even realized she'd gotten up from her table to load up another plate of food. The girl smiled at her, "No problem. I know I take up a bit more space than normal."

Emily watched as the girl turned her attention back to loading up her plate. She seemed so confident in her size. It didn't seem to bother her at all that she was fat. On top of that, Emily couldn't deny that there was something about her that was quite beautiful. It seemed like all that weight made her look perfect as it smoothed her out and made her look very inviting and kind. She unconsciously found herself loading up her plate to match the girl's heavy meal before heading back towards her own table.

"Looks like someone's hungry." Michael said as she sat down, "Though, that's good. I usually have to prod you just to eat enough."

Emily took one more look at the fat girl, "Yeah, I figured I should probably eat a bit more so I don't space out so often."

"That's what I've been trying to tell you." Michael laughed, "You couldn't even feed a mouse with how much you normally eat."

Emily glanced at her plate as she began eating, unable to look Michael in the eyes. Michael seemed to realize how uncomfortable she was feeling and quickly changed the subject to a new band he'd just heard about. She quickly relaxed and even went back for another plate that almost mirrored the first before finally getting dessert. All the while they chatted and laughed, and Emily even forgot about the fat girl she'd seen until they were ready to leave.

Emily let out a little belch as she rubbed her belly. She was definitely fuller than she normally was, though that was to be expected with how much she'd eaten. She was sure that she'd gone past the point of a normal meal and into overeating. Still, the three girls were still at their table with more food in front of them. She couldn't believe that they weren't done eating yet. They'd been there before Emily and Michael got there, and they didn't seem like they were slowing down.

She felt that fluttering in her chest again as she admired how beautiful the girl looked, and she imagined that as her. She imagined what it would be like to be that fat and still be so confident. It actually made her think of Sam and how she didn't seem to care that she was fat. Actually, those two might get along just great.

She took one last look at the girl before following Michael through the crowded restaurant towards the exit. She shivered slightly as the cool evening air enveloped her. She was glad that she had her hoodie on with how much colder it was now.

Michael turned and pulled her into a warm hug, "So what did you want to do now?"

Have fun, everyone!"
